sentences: SBI Chair Owen-Jones introduced draft SBI conclusions (FCCC/SBI/2011/L.19).
SAUDI ARABIA and the US identified the need for further work.

After further informal consultations focusing on enhancing participation by observer organizations, parties agreed to recommend that, in cases where there is no contact group on an agenda item, at least the first and last informal meetings can be open to observers, while recognizing the right of parties to keep informal meetings closed. SAUDI ARABIA and ANTIGUA AND BARBUDA, opposed by MEXICO, AUSTRALIA and COLOMBIA, proposed that examination of options for new channels for observer organizations to provide inputs into the COP and COP/MOP be deferred to SBI 36 instead of SBI 35.
Parties eventually agreed to defer the consideration of the issue until SBI 36 and the SBI adopted the conclusions as amended.
Many parties expressed support for the enhanced engagement of observers.
AUSTRALIA, the COOK ISLANDS and GRENADA also welcomed the upcoming UNFCCC special event on observer participation at COP 17.
